course.title: Build 15 Augmented Reality (AR) apps with Unity & Vuforia
course.subtitle: Augmented reality (AR) tutorials on Markerless tracking, Cloud AR, 3D Object detection, + more with Unity & Vuforia

reviews.body: For the past few weeks, I have been looking for a course that would allow me to get an idea of how to start with augmented reality. As someone that has been going through the course for the past 5 days or so, I can highly recommend this course to anyone wanting to learn AR. I have also noticed that Professor Dinesh responds quite quickly and frequently to those that have questions on subjects they need a better understand of or if looking online can't help them. Good luck everyone!
Well delivered! This course is loaded with great information to get you started with AR with Unity and Vuforia. I would like to see more from this instructor.

In the beginning lectures, i found difficulties as there were some numerous errors on during working mainly due to version issues. I have downloaded 3-4 versions to understand the differences and which version is working correctly as per the video andlatest versions of Vuforia and Unity.

The Augmented Reality concepts and tools explained in detail and clearly. Unity game engine panels and options mentioned. Voice modulation issues while moving from one chapter to another, but still manageable. Thanks.

Learnt a lot - but Vuforia is very buggy and constantly changing. As much as the Instructor tries to update the videos, there are still issues.

That said, this allowed me to make some simple demos in AR for show.

Thats absolutely perfect. I liked the way of his instructing. Anyone who wants to learn Vuforia, can purchase without hesitating.

(I wish he updates the content according to 2020 version. It looks very old fashioned. Also I wish the course had Vuforia area target lessons.)

Rest of all is perfect :)

I wanted to give it more stars but I couldn't

First of all, I learned a lot of things from AR, it is a completely new subject to me, the problem is that if you come here with an Intermediate or more advanced level of Unity Engine you may feel it slow, I expended most of the time fast forwarding the videos because of this.

I wasn't sure first to buy this course because I read that it was a little outdated, but the instructor did a good job adressing those problems.

Now this is related to vuforia, I sugest you to look wich devices are compatible with certain features, because I couldn't complete at least two sections of the course by this cause.

Neverless, you will definitely learn the basics of Vuforia and it will give you a general view of it, and if you have little to no experience in Unity this course is for you.

This was a really good course covering the basics of using Vuforia with Unity. The way of explaining the procedure could be improved. There is no need to explain what button you click each time and many such trivial things during development. Rather focus on the reasoning... why you follow so and so way! (one example - you say you click on "legacy" while applying animation to model. But you never say why you choose that over the other types of animation)
good but cloud recognition can explained detailed
It was Excellent. Explanations are clear and easy to try.
Awesome content, whether you know Unity or not it doesn't matter. Everything you will learn. I recommend to take the course. yes if you have Unity knowledge then it will help.
Its is being a very good and informative course!!!

instructor.name: Dinesh Tavasalkar
instructor.briefIntroduction:
I'm a Professional freelance Trainer and Developer. Over the last 6 years I have conducted more than 100+ training's covering topics like Robotics, Internet of Things, Arduino, Raspberry Pi, Android App Development, 3D Game Development using Unity, Robot Hacking, 3D Printing, Quadcopter, Web Development with Wordpress.

I have conducted one of the Biggest Internet of Things training in India with approximately 600 students present for the event. 

I was invited to judge Android App Development & 3D Game Development event in one of the top Engineering Institutes in Chennai, 

I also have a YouTube channel by the name of EngineersDream, where I teach Android Application Development
